block.p: Lindsey Beth LaBoon, a daughter of Barbara Stern of Boca Raton, Fla., and Lawrence LaBoon of Phoenixville, Pa., is to be married today to Samuel Flom Rothenberg, a son of Mary Sue and Frederick Rothenberg of Tampa, Fla. Rabbi David Englander is to perform the ceremony at B'nai Torah Congregation in Boca Raton.

The bride, 24, and bridegroom, 27, met at George Washington University, where they received master's degrees in international affairs. They are to begin work next month as junior Foreign Service officers at the State Department in Arlington, Va.

Lindsey Beth LaBoon, a daughter of Barbara Stern of Boca Raton, Fla., and Lawrence LaBoon of Phoenixville, Pa., is to be married today to Samuel Flom Rothenberg, a son of Mary Sue and Frederick Rothenberg of Tampa, Fla. Rabbi David Englander is to perform the ceremony at Bâ€™nai Torah Congregation in Boca Raton.

Lindsey Beth LaBoon, a daughter of Barbara Stern of Boca Raton, Fla., and Lawrence LaBoon of Phoenixville, Pa., is to be married today to Samuel Flom Rothenberg, a son of Mary Sue and Frederick Rothenberg of Tampa, Fla. Rabbi David Englander is to perform the ceremony at B'nai Torah Congregation in Boca Raton.

The bride, 24, and bridegroom, 27, met at George Washington University, where they received master's degrees in international affairs. They are to begin work next month as junior Foreign Service officers at the State Department in Arlington, Va.
The bride received two bachelor's degrees from the University of Florida, graduating cum laude in Spanish and summa cum laude in economics; the bridegroom graduated from Dartmouth.
The bride is a stepdaughter of Glynys LaBoon and Robert Stern.
